content:
I've added those to your loyalty program list. Here's the updated summary:

**The Daily Grind (Coffee Shop)**

* Earning structure: 10 points per dollar spent
* Rewards redemption: Unknown (please let me know how you redeem your points)

**SaveMart (Grocery Store)**

* Earning structure: 1% cashback on all purchases
* Rewards redemption: Cashback rewards (no minimum redemption amount mentioned)

**Gap (Clothing Store)**

* Earning structure: Unknown (please let me know how you earn points)
* Rewards redemption: 1,200 points = $10 in rewards

**Sephora (Beauty Store)**

* Earning structure: Unknown (please let me know how you earn points)
* Rewards redemption: 500 points = VIB level (free shipping and exclusive offers)

**CVS (Pharmacy)**

* Earning structure: Unknown (please let me know how you earn rewards)
* Rewards redemption: Unknown (please let me know how you redeem your rewards)

**Pizza Hut (Food Delivery)**

* Earning structure: Unknown (please let me know how you earn rewards)
* Rewards redemption: Unknown (please let me know how you redeem your rewards)

**Office Depot (Office Supplies)**

* Earning structure: $1 for every $10 spent
* Rewards redemption: Cashback rewards (no minimum redemption amount mentioned)

To help me better track your loyalty programs, could you please provide the following information:

* How you earn points at Sephora (e.g., 1 point per dollar, 5 points per dollar, etc.)
* How you earn rewards at Gap (e.g., 1 point per dollar, 5 points per dollar, etc.)
* How you earn rewards at CVS (e.g., 1% cashback, points per dollar, etc.)
* How you earn rewards at Pizza Hut (e.g., points per order, cashback, etc.)

Once I have this information, I can help you keep track of your points and rewards more accurately.
